text: Limousin is a former administrative region of France. It is now part of the administrative region of Nouvelle-Aquitaine. Its capital was Limoges. With 42 people per square kilometer, this was one of the least populated regions. About 710,000 people lived on roughly . The departments in the region were Corr√®ze, Creuse, and Haute-Vienne. The local economy had been recentered around services. Category:Former administrative regions of France *
title: Limousin
